segments.text: I notice the woman first, so absorbed in drying her plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron is tied neatly, but water is flooding the sink behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's overflowing onto the floor, and she's standing right in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What a mess; the puddle is spreading everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window above lets in light, showing the garden outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's pretty out there, with bushes and a path, totally serene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But inside, the boy's on that unstable stool by the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's got his hand in the cookie jar, looking mischievous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is reaching toward him, excited for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's legs are splayed; it could tip at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Open cabinet doors frame them like a picture of trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes on the counter look ready to be stored, but forgotten.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This domestic scene is hiding so many little disasters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe no one's noticing the chaos building up.
segments.speaker: PAR
